title: JIT unable to compile range with 2 arguments
body_html:
🐛 Bug

JIT is unable to compile range with more than 1 argument.

JIT can compile range(10) and cannot compile range(0, 10)

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

range() expects 1 argument but got 2:
@torch.jit.script_method
def inference(self, line_tensor):
    # type: (torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor
    hidden = self.init_hidden()

    # TODO: Question: how do you initialize output
    # below is needed to delcare the type of output to be Tensor
    output = torch.zeros(0)
    for i in range(1, line_tensor.size(0)):
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~...  <--- HERE
        output, hidden = self(line_tensor[i], hidden)

    return output

Expected behavior

Should support 2 arguments

Environment

Please copy and paste the output from our

PyTorch version: 1.0.0a0+f282fa1
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 8.0.61

OS: Ubuntu 14.04.5 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 4.8.4-2ubuntu1~14.04.4) 4.8.4
CMake version: version 3.12.2

Python version: 2.7
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: Could not collect
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 1080
Nvidia driver version: 396.24.02
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.5.1.5
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.6.0.21
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.1.4
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn_static_v6.a
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn_static_v7.a

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] numpy (1.15.3)
[pip] numpydoc (0.8.0)
[pip] torch (1.0.0a0+f282fa1)
[pip] torchvision (0.2.1)
[conda] magma-cuda80 2.3.0 1 pytorch
[conda] pytorch 0.4.1 py27__9.0.176_7.1.2_2 pytorch
[conda] torch 1.0.0a0+f282fa1
[conda] torchvision 0.2.1 py27_1 pytorch

Additional context

body:
## 🐛 Bug

JIT is unable to compile range with more than 1 argument.

JIT can compile `range(10)` and cannot compile `range(0, 10)`

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

```
range() expects 1 argument but got 2:
@torch.jit.script_method
def inference(self, line_tensor):
    # type: (torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor
    hidden = self.init_hidden()

    # TODO: Question: how do you initialize output
    # below is needed to delcare the type of output to be Tensor
    output = torch.zeros(0)
    for i in range(1, line_tensor.size(0)):
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~...  <--- HERE
        output, hidden = self(line_tensor[i], hidden)

    return output
```

## Expected behavior

Should support 2 arguments

## Environment

Please copy and paste the output from our

PyTorch version: 1.0.0a0+f282fa1
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 8.0.61

OS: Ubuntu 14.04.5 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 4.8.4-2ubuntu1~14.04.4) 4.8.4
CMake version: version 3.12.2

Python version: 2.7
Is CUDA available: Yes
